people.translation[0].definitions[0].def: used as the plural of ‘person’ to refer to men, women, and children
people.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: How many people were at the meeting?
the people who live next door
people.translation[0].definitions[1].def: people in general, or people other than yourself
people.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: I don’t care what people think.
People can be really mean sometimes.
The hotel was full of business people.
people.translation[0].definitions[2].def: the people who belong to a particular country, race, or area
people.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: He pledged that he would never lie to the American people.
the Basques, a people of northwestern Spain
people.translation[0].definitions[3].def: used to get the attention of a group of people
people.translation[0].note_box[0].items[: People is followed by a plural verb
The American people are proud of their democracy
The American people is proud of its democracy
people.translation[0].note_box[1].sectio: Most people know that smoking causes lung cancer.
People are the same everywhere.
folk
Louisa's parents were country folk and believed very much in herbal remedies.
They looked like two ordinary folk.
There are still folk around here who remember the old days.
the public
ordinary people, not people who belong to the government or are members of a particular company or organization
This information should be made available to the public.
population
all the people who live in a particular area
The majority of the population were farmers.
The city has a population of 11 million.
the human race
all the people in the world, considered as a group
the origins of the human race
mankind

people in general – used especially when talking about their history or development, or how something affects their existence. Some people think that the word mankind seems to make women seem unimportant, and prefer to use humankind instead
Travelling into space was a great advance for mankind.
populace
the people who live in a country – a very formal use
It is a country where 80% of the populace live in poverty.
people.translation[1].definitions[0].def: if a country or area is peopled by people of a particular type, they live there
people.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: an island peopled by hardy sea folk
people.translation[1].definitions[1].def: if a story or someone’s imagination is peopled by people of a particular type, it is full of them
people.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: Her world was peopled with imaginary friends.
people.translation[2].definitions[0].def: a US magazine that contains short articles and pictures of famous people, especially people who appear on television and in films
people.translation[3].definitions[0].def: a British tabloid newspaper sold every Sunday, which is known for printing shocking articles about famous people, especially about their relationships and their sexual experiences
